subject: AI & Agents
title: Training vs Inference
description: A short lesson to help you apply Training vs Inference.

hook.text: Training is studying for the exam. Inference is taking it.

buildup.text: During training, a model adjusts millions of parameters to minimize errors.

discovery.text: Once trained, the model is frozen. Inference means applying what it learned to new inputs.

twist.text: Training GPT-4 cost over $100 million. Running a single query costs a fraction of a cent.

climax.text: You interact with AI at inference time â€” the expensive learning already happened.

punchline.text: Training is the homework. Inference is the exam.

quiz.question: What is inference in AI?
options: Applying a trained model to new data
